intro: Polygonum arcuatum, commonly known as the curved knotweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a reddish or purple hue on the underside. Polygonum arcuatum produces small, clustered flowers in late summer, which are usually pink or white, and it is often found in moist, disturbed soils such as streambanks and roadsides.
